mudServer.Mobiles
Class Player

java.lang.Object
  mudServer.Mobiles.MobileStd
      mudServer.Mobiles.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Mobile
public class Player
extends MobileStd
implements Mobile

Players. Each player will have a set of stats, such as the player's name. Each will hold items as well. Each player will be responsible for sending and receiving messages to and from it's remote client.

Author:
Nemesis

recieveMessage

public java.lang.String recieveMessage()
Returns a message from the client. This method uses a safe algorithm in order to read from the BufferedReader. This is neccessary due to the fact that the readLine() method hangs.

Returns:
The received message.

savePlayer

public void savePlayer()
Saves a player to a file.

loadPlayer

public void loadPlayer(java.lang.String thisName)
Load a player from a file. The file must already exist on the server.

Parameters:
thisName - The name of the player being loaded.
